Attributes.Prompt: Specify round up of device calculation for nearest amount value.
Attributes.Definition: Result of (Device Cost − Device Subsidy) / Contract Period can be rounded up to a decimal or whole number. For example, if 0 is specified, result will not be rounded (e.g. 12.23 --> 12.23). If 0.5 is specified, result will be rounded up to nearest 0.5 (e.g. 12.23 --> 12.50). If 2 is specified, result will be rounded up to nearest even number (e.g. 13.12 --> 14.00), and so on.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify what happens to device contract when the base plan flavor is changed.
Attributes.Format: "Apply Exit Policy;Change Device Flavor to Match Base Plan;Keep Device Flavor"
Attributes.Definition: Specify the rule that should be applied when the base plan is upgraded or downgraded.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify list of Device SICs separated by semicolon.
Attributes.Definition: List of Device SICs is needed to configure the devices on the system.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify initial device cost that will be used as base for calculations.
Attributes.Definition: The original device cost (which doesn't include profit margin) or the retail cost (which includes profit margin) can be used as the base of the initial device cost.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify subsidy amount for the devices.
Attributes.Definition: A device can be subsidized to reduce its cost so that it can attract customers to buy it. Usually, a subsidized device is provided as installments and bundled with other services.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify type of the device.
Attributes.Definition: Type of device denotes whether specific devices should be restricted for provisioning.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify Finance GL code for this charge.
Attributes.Definition: GL (General Ledger) Code is used by Finance for revenue bookings.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify maximum device cost that can be sold to the customer.
Attributes.Definition: The maximum device cost which can be provided to the customer can be restricted so that only devices below or equal the maxim allowed cost can be provided. This can be used to assure revenues as higher device costs can be riskier to recover its cost via indirect revenues.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Device can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify how to handle if the subsidy amount doesn't cover the device cost.
Attributes.Format: "Charge as Installements;Charge as One-Time;Don't Allow Device"
Attributes.Definition: In case the subsidy amount on the device doesn't cover its cost completely, then this can be handled in three different ways: spread this extra charge as periodic installments, post the extra charge as a one-time charge, or prevent the customer from taking the device when the subsidy cannot cover its cost.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify required tags on the device so it becomes applicable. (Empty means any tag)
Attributes.Definition: Certain tags on the device can be used to restrict the allowed devices.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify channel of communication where the user will get the inquiry feedback.
Attributes.Definition: Inquiry feedback message can be send to the customer as USSD, SMS, or Email.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify message content that user will receive in reply to the inquiry request.
Attributes.Default: "Dear Etisalat customer, you have consumed all your freebees. To get more, contact Etisalat."
Attributes.Definition: Feedback text can contain any characters but it should within characters limit if the channel is USSD or SMS. If special information should be included, then they should be included in curly braces such as {Remaining Call Freebees Amount} or {Expiry Date}.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify channel of communication that the user should use to inquire.
Attributes.Definition: Customer can initiate the inquiry by sending a text to USSD, SMS, or Email.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify command and destination that the user should send to get inquiry.
Attributes.Definition: Inquiry command should state the text that the customer should send for the inquiry and the destination which should process the inquiry request.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional requirements on Inquiry property can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify SMS short code or Email address that will send the message reply of the inquiry.
Attributes.Definition: In case the "Inquiry Channel" is SMS, the short code of the sender is required. In case the "Inquiry Channel" is Email, the email address of the sender is required.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify services (Call/Message/Data) for which the usage should be inquired.
Attributes.Format: "Call;Message;Data;Call and Message;Call and Data;Message and Data;Call, Message and Data"
Attributes.Definition: A single inquiry feedback message can contain information about the freebees consumption or tariff usage of Call, Message, or Data.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify numeric value for notification event.
Attributes.Definition: For certain Notification Events, another value need to be specified.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Notification can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify channel of communication that the user will get the notification.
Attributes.Definition: Notification message can be send to the customer as USSD, SMS, or Email.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify what triggers the notification.
Attributes.Format: "Freebees 60% Reached, Freebees 80% Reached, Freebees 100% Reached;Freebees 80% Reached, Freebees 90% Reached, Freebees 100% Reached"
Attributes.Definition: Notification Event specifies the condition that triggers the sending of the message to the customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify message content that will be sent to user for the first usage notification.
Attributes.Default: "Dear Etisalat customer, your freebees consumption is started."
Attributes.Definition: Notification text can contain any characters but it should within characters limit if the channel is USSD or SMS. If special information should be included, then they should be included in curly braces such as {Remaining Call Freebees Amount} or {Expiry Date}.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify SMS short code or Email address that will send the notification.
Attributes.Definition: In case the "Notification Channel" is SMS, the short code of the sender is required. In case the "Notification Channel" is Email, the email address of the sender is required.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify services (Call/Message/Data) for which the usage notification should be sent.
Attributes.Format: "Call;Message;Data;Call and Message;Call and Data;Message and Data;Call, Message and Data"
Attributes.Definition: A single notification message can contain information about the freebees consumption or tariff usage of Call, Message, or Data.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify definition of the custom property.
Attributes.Definition: Text in the definition can be used to explain the purpose of the custom rule.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify formatting of the value of the custom property.
Attributes.Definition: Format of the value can affect its appearance especially for numeric values. For example a date value can be formatted as "ddd dd-MMM-YYYY".

Attributes.Prompt: Specify label of the custom property.
Attributes.Definition: Label appears as few words that used to name the custom rule.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Custom can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify user prompt of the custom property.
Attributes.Definition: Text in the prompt can be used to display some information to the user.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify type of the value of the custom property.
Attributes.Definition: Value type of the custom rule can be defined so that value input can be restricted. Supported types are: String, Number, Date, Currency, Boolean, Fixed List, and Variable List.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify value of the custom property.
Attributes.Definition: Value of the custom rule can be predefined or it can be left blank.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify full path location of the file.
Attributes.Definition: File Location

Attributes.Prompt: Specify name of the file.
Attributes.Definition: File Name

Attributes.Prompt: Specify type of the file.
Attributes.Definition: File Type

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional requirements on File property can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify names of the users who can access the report: Name/Section/username/EmployeeID (comma separated).
Attributes.Definition: Details of users that should be configured to have access to the reports.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional requirements on Report property can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify columns to be displayed in the report (comma separated).
Attributes.Definition: Column names should corresponds to values in the service that can be generated automatically.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify frequency of the report.
Attributes.Definition: Report Cycle specifies the frequency of the report generation.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify name of the report.
Attributes.Definition: The name required for the report title.

Attributes.Definition: Channel

Attributes.Definition: Support Contact

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether MSISDN change is allowed or not.
Attributes.Definition: MSISDN change determines whether the plans and features can continue or not.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether the contract can be transferred to the new MSISDN or not.
Attributes.Format: "Block Unless Contract is Exited;Transfer Contract As-is;Transfer and Restart Contract"
Attributes.Definition: Contract on the original owner may or may not be transferred to the new MSISDN

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on MSISDN Change can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify effect of the ownership transfer on the base plan and add-ons.
Attributes.Format: "Transfer Base Plan and Add-ons;Transfer Base Plan and Cease Add-ons (Exit Policy Applied);Cease Base Plan and Add-ons (Exit Policy Applied);Number Change Not Allowed"
Attributes.Definition: The current features on the previous MSISDN can continue or cease.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether add-on freebees are transferred to the new MSISDN or lost.
Attributes.Definition: Unused freebees can be transfer to the new MSISDN or removed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether ownership transfer is allowed or not.
Attributes.Definition: Ownership transfer (AKA subscribership transfer) determines whether the owner of an account (MSISDN) can be changed or not.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether the contract can be transferred to the new owner or not.
Attributes.Format: "Block Unless Contract is Exited;Transfer Contract As-is;Transfer and Restart Contract"
Attributes.Definition: Contract on the original owner may or may not be transferred to the new owner.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify how to handle amount due.
Attributes.Format: "Balance Remains With Original Owner;Balance Transferred to New Owner;Balance Should Be Settled First"
Attributes.Definition: Existing unsettled amount due need to be handled properly when for the ownership transfer to occur correctly.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Ownership Change can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify charges to be applied due.
Attributes.Definition: Charge can be applied due to Ownership transfer action.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify effect of the ownership transfer on the base plan and add-ons.
Attributes.Format: "Transfer Base Plan and Add-ons;Transfer Base Plan and Cease Add-ons (Exit Policy Applied);Cease Base Plan and Add-ons (Exit Policy Applied);Ownership Transfer Not Allowed"
Attributes.Definition: Owner of the account can be changed after the current owner pays the charges. However, the current features might continue to live for next owner or could be terminated.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether add-on freebees are transferred to the new owner or kept with original owner.
Attributes.Definition: Unused freebees can be transfer to the new owner or remain with the original owner.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify name of the account.
Attributes.Definition: Account name must be a unique name that should not be repeated in any service.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify type of the account.
Attributes.Definition: Account Type defines where the charges are posted. Usually accounts are isolated so the individuals are responsible for the charges. For Linked Account, the customer enjoys the benefits but the charges are posted to the corporate account (sometimes called as Dummy account).

Attributes.Prompt: Specify text that appears in the bill for this charge.
Attributes.Definition: Invoice words specify the text that should appear in the invoice which will inform the customer about the this account.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify number of accounts that can be linked to this account.
Attributes.Definition: In case of Master account, the number of allowed linked account can be limited. 0 means no limit.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Account can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify effect of the ownership transfer on the base plan and add-ons.
Attributes.Format: "Keep Base Plan and Add-ons;Keep Base Plan and Cease Add-ons;Cease Base Plan and Add-ons;Ownership Transfer Not Allowed"
Attributes.Definition: Owner of the account can be changed after the current owner pays the charges. However, the current features might continue to live for next owner or could be terminated.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify number of this same account that a user can subscribe.
Attributes.Definition: Multiple accounts of same type can be restricted to a specific number. 0 means no limit. [REMOVE THIS. Already captured in base plan]

Attributes.Definition: Customers are segmented according to Sales. Certain customer segments can be allowed to get this service.

Attributes.Definition: Only CRM users with certain access role can be limited to do the subscription of the product.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify when the activation should happen.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether the existing customers can subscribe to this plan or not.
Attributes.Format: "Port-in Only;New Customer Only;Existing Customer Only;New & Existing Customers"
Attributes.Definition: A plan can be restricted to port-in customers (coming from other operators), to new customers which includes port-in customers, to existing customers who have an account with Etisalat, or open to all customers whether they are new or existing.

Attributes.Default: "Your request to subscribe for <Service Name> was failed due to <failure reason>."
Attributes.Definition: Failure Text will display a text informing the user that the subscription or cessation request has failed. It is important to include the failure reasons to the user that blocked the request otherwise the user might repeat the same request.

Attributes.Definition: Short description of the project that gives high level abstraction about its goals.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify target start date of the project.
Attributes.Definition: The expected or agreed start date of the project.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify grace period that the freebees should continue to exist.
Attributes.Definition: Carry-Over Cycles determines whether to add the unused freebees to the next freebees cycle(s) or remove the unused freebees at the end of the cycle. For example, if a customer has a 100 min monthly freebees and 50 min were consumed only by the end of the month and Carry-Over is allowed, then customer will get 150 min in the next month.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify how the list of destination numbers can be defined.
Attributes.Format: "Changeable by Etisalat only;Changeable by Customer only;Changeable by Etisalat and Customer"
Attributes.Definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be defined and changed by Etisalat sales or it can be defined and changed by the customer or both. Authorized Etisalat users can use CRM for updating the list. Customer can send SMS message for updating this list.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify amount of freebees to offer.
Attributes.Definition: The amount of call freebees to offer to the customer and it will be treated as free duration period or free charge amount.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify capping rule when all freebees are consumed.
Attributes.Definition: "Freebees Cap" determines whether out-of-bundle charge is allowed after full consumption of freebees amount or not. Most of Freebees allow OOB charge. However, for Data Freebees, the customer can select and change any time whether this should be set to Soft Cap or Hard Cap.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify amount of duration.
Attributes.Definition: Freebees can be specified to last for certain amount of duration type.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
Attributes.Definition: Freebees can last based on certain duration type which can be day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

Attributes.Prompt: Specify priority with respect to other call freebees.
Attributes.Definition: Priority specifies when the freebees consumption should happen when there are other call freebees exist on the same account.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify when the freebees start date should begin.
Attributes.Definition: Freebees Start defines when the freebees consumption timer should begin. On Subscription causes the freebees timer to start immediately whether a customer made usages or not. On First Usage will trigger the Freebees timer only when the customer makes any usage. Usually for periodic freebees, this is set to On Subscription. However, for one-time freebees, this selection has a significant difference.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify unit of freebees amount.
Attributes.Definition: Freebees unit specifies what kind of usage that should be considered as freebees. If freebees consumption is based on a specific Charge amount, then usage charges up to this amount will not billed to the customer. If freebees consumption is based on a specific Duration amount, then usage charges up to this period will not billed to the customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify maximum changes allowed per month to the list of destination numbers.
Attributes.Definition: Changes to list of F&F destination numbers can be restricte to certain times per month. When the number of changes per month is reached, the next change cannot happen till next month.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify how many numbers allowed in the list of destination numbers.
Attributes.Definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be restricted to a limited numbers.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify nature of the call.
Attributes.Definition: STD is for national calls. CUG is for calls within same group (Community ID). IDD is for international calls. ICR is for incoming roaming calls. OGR is for outgoing roaming calls. FLEXI is any combination of STD, CUG, IDD, ICR, and OGR.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify network categories for the call.
Attributes.Format: "Mobile and Fixed Lines;Mobile Lines Only;Fixed Lines Only"
Attributes.Definition: Network lines determine whether freebees calls to be restricted of Mobile network only, Fixed network only, or any network. This is useful to be able to make things like freebees to fixed lines only. Note that further restriction can be done by configuring "Direction" attribute.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Call Freebees can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify out-of-bundle charge of the call.
Attributes.Definition: The monetary amount that should be charged to customer against each usage pulse. This will be either AED X per Second or AED X per Minute.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify charging pulse of the call.
Attributes.Definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

Attributes.Prompt: Specify allowed only call destinations.
Attributes.Definition: Target destinations can be restricted to certain list so that any communication attempt by the customer on destinations outside the list is not allowed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify allowed only call sources.
Attributes.Definition: Source initiators can be restricted to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators outside the list is not allowed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify blocked call destinations.
Attributes.Definition: Target destinations can be blocked to certain list so that any communication attempt by the customer on destinations in the list is not allowed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify blocked call sources.
Attributes.Definition: Source initiators can be blocked to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators in the list is not allowed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether the freebees should be prorated based on the day of the month when exit happens.
Attributes.Definition: In most cases, freebees are not prorated on exit which means the unused freebees will continue till end of the cycle.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether the freebees should be prorated based on the day of the month when subscription or upgrade/downgrade happens.
Attributes.Definition: Usually, freebees are prorated when the refill is periodic and the base plan is Postpaid. Note that proration of the charge should match the freebees.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify cycles which the freebees should be refilled.
Attributes.Definition: Refill Cycles determines the behavior of freebees when the Duration is completed. Usually freebees is provided as one-time only or as auto-renew. Monthly auto-renew method behaves differently on Prepaid than on Postpaid. On Prepaid, the start of each cycle is the same day of the month when the first cycle was activated. For Postpaid, the start of each cycle is the first day of the month. That's why prorate happens on first month when the base plan is Postpaid.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify technology type of the call.
Attributes.Definition: Call freebees can be configured for Voice calls or Video calls. Note that Voice calls and Video calls are based on "circuit switching" which means the connection line between the caller and the called person is fully occupied by this call and not shared with other calls (unlike "packet switching" which is IP based and allows multiple calls to share the same line). Most of the calls are Voice calls and there are very less calls based on Video. Video calls are not popular because of limited handsets support, no freebees offers on Video calls, and customer awareness.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify charging pulse of the call.
Attributes.Definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether the charge should be billed against master account or individual account.
Attributes.Definition: Usually the individual is responsible of the usage charges. However, the charges can be posted to the family head or the company which the account is linked to it.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify text that appears in the bill for this charge.
Attributes.Definition: Billing words specify the text that should appear in the invoice which will inform the customer about the type of this usage charges.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify how the list of destination numbers can be defined.
Attributes.Format: "Changeable by Etisalat only;Changeable by Customer only;Changeable by Etisalat and Customer"
Attributes.Definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be defined and changed by Etisalat sales or it can be defined and changed by the customer or both. Authorized Etisalat users can use CRM for updating the list. Customer can send SMS message for updating this list.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify how many numbers allowed in the list of destination numbers.
Attributes.Definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be restricted to a limited numbers.

Attributes.Definition: STD is for national calls. CUG is for calls within same group (Community ID). IDD is for international calls. ICR is for incoming roaming calls. OGR is for outgoing roaming calls. FLEXI is any combination of STD, CUG, IDD, ICR, and OGR.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional requirements on Call Tariff property can be added here.

Attributes.Definition: Source initiators can be restricted to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators outside the list is not allowed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify blocked call destinations.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify blocked call sources.
Attributes.Definition: Source initiators can be blocked to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators in the list is not allowed.

Attributes.Definition: The monetary amount that should be charged to customer against each call regardless of its duration.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify tariff charge of the call.
Attributes.Definition: The monetary amount that should be charged to customer against each usage pulse. This will be either AED X per Second or AED X per Minute.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify unit of tariff amount.
Attributes.Definition: Tariff charge can be specified in different unit than actual pulse unit so it can be understood easily.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify allowed destinations of Data.
Attributes.Format: "All Internet;Social only;Email only;Social and Email only;Corporate APN only;Custom Destinations"
Attributes.Definition: Data freebees can offered for specific websites or protocols or for generic access. Corporate APN will cause the mobile Data traffic to be routed corporate server.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify maximum download bandwidth speed for Data link.
Attributes.Definition: Maximum allowed link speed for data traffic when customer receives data from the other end.

Attributes.Format: "1 Kilobyte is 1000 Bytes;1 Kilobyte is 1024 Bytes"
Attributes.Definition: Data unit comes in many denominations: Byte, Kilobyte, Megabyte, Gigabyte, ..etc. However, high level denomination can be defined in terms of one level lower as either 1000 or 1024 multiples of it.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify technology type of the message.
Attributes.Definition: Call Tariff can be configured for Voice calls or Video calls. Note that Voice calls and Video calls are based on "circuit switching" which means the connection line between the caller and the called person is fully occupied by this call and not shared with other calls (unlike "packet switching" which is IP based and allows multiple calls to share the same line). Most of the calls are Voice calls and there are very less calls based on Video. Video calls are not popular because of limited handsets support, no freebees offers on Video calls, and customer awareness.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify charging pulse of the message.
Attributes.Definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Rewards can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify amount of reward points to offer.
Attributes.Definition: The amount of rewards to be given to the customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify type of rewards to offer.
Attributes.Format: "Points;Call STD Min.;Call CUG Min.;Call IDD Min.;Call FLEXI Min.;Call FnF Min.;Call ICR Min.;Call OGR Min.;SMS STD;SMS CUG;SMS IDD;SMS FLEXI;SMS FnF;SMS ICR;SMS OGR;Data Local;Data Roaming"
Attributes.Definition: The type of rewards to be given to the customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify trigger amount that causes the rewards to be offered.
Attributes.Definition: The amount of action type that triggers the rewards to be given to the customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify trigger limit to restrict number of rewards to be given to the customer.
Attributes.Definition: Trigger can be restricted to certain count instead of indefinitely.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify trigger type that causes the rewards to be offered.
Attributes.Format: "Daily;Weekly;Monthly;Quarterly;Yearly;Call STD Min.;Call CUG Min.;Call IDD Min.;Call FLEXI Min.;Call ICR Min.;Call OGR Min.;SMS STD;SMS CUG;SMS IDD;SMS FLEXI;SMS ICR;SMS OGR;Data Local;Data Roaming"
Attributes.Definition: The action type that causes the rewards to be offered to the customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify grace period that the credit should continue to exist.
Attributes.Definition: Carry-Over Cycles determines whether to add the unused credit to the next credit cycle(s) or remove the unused credit at the end of the cycle. For example, if a customer has a 100 min monthly credit and 50 min were consumed only by the end of the month and Carry-Over is allowed, then customer will get 150 min in the next month.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify amount of credit to offer.
Attributes.Definition: The amount of call credit to offer to the customer and it will be treated as free duration period or free charge amount.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify amount of duration.
Attributes.Definition: Credit can be specified to last for certain amount of duration type.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
Attributes.Definition: Credit can last based on certain duration type which can be day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

Attributes.Prompt: Specify priority with respect to other credits.
Attributes.Definition: Priority specifies when the credit consumption should happen when there are other call credit exist on the same account.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify when the credit start date should begin.
Attributes.Definition: Credit Start defines when the credit consumption timer should begin. On Subscription causes the credit timer to start immediately whether a customer made usages or not. On First Usage will trigger the Credit timer only when the customer makes any usage. Usually for periodic credit, this is set to On Subscription. However, for one-time credit, this selection has a significant difference.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Usages Credit can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether the credit should be prorated based on the day of the month when exit happens.
Attributes.Definition: In most cases, credit are not prorated on exit which means the unused credit will continue till end of the cycle.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether the credit should be prorated based on the day of the month when subscription or upgrade/downgrade happens.
Attributes.Definition: Usually, credit are prorated when the refill is periodic and the base plan is Postpaid. Note that proration of the charge should match the credit.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify cycles which the credit should be refilled.
Attributes.Definition: Refill Cycles determines the behavior of credit when the Duration is completed. Usually credit is provided as one-time only or as auto-renew. Monthly auto-renew method behaves differently on Prepaid than on Postpaid. On Prepaid, the start of each cycle is the same day of the month when the first cycle was activated. For Postpaid, the start of each cycle is the first day of the month. That's why prorate happens on first month when the base plan is Postpaid.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify charging pulse of the credit monetary reduction.
Attributes.Definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for credit call is set to "Per Minute".

Attributes.Definition: Usually the individual is responsible of the usage charges. However, the charges can be posted to the family head or the company which the account is linked to it.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether the contract show automatically renew after completing the contract period.
Attributes.Definition: Contract can be set to automatically renew for the same contract period without customer involvement in which case the exit policy will be applicable again.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify amount of duration.
Attributes.Definition: Contract can be specified to lapse for certain amount of duration type.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
Attributes.Definition: Contract can be specified as a duration type which can be day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

Attributes.Prompt: Specify policy when exiting the contract before completing the contract period.
Attributes.Format: "No Charge;One Month Charge;Monthly Charge x Remaining Months;One Fixed Charge;Fixed Charge x Remaining Months"
Attributes.Definition: Exit policy can be: No Charge, One Month Charge, Monthly Charge x Remaining Months, One Fixed Charge, or Fixed Charge x Remaining Months.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify amount of fixed charge.
Attributes.Definition: In case "One Fixed Charge" or "Fixed Charge x Remaining Months" is selected, then the fixed charge amount should be specified here.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Contract can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify name of the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Add-on name must be a unique name that should not be repeated in any service. Add-on name should include flavor name so it is distinctively identifiable.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify scope of the add-on.
Attributes.Format: "For Specific Base Plans;For Any Base Plan"
Attributes.Definition: From service construction point of view, there are two kinds of add-ons: add-on limited to specific base plans (Add-on) and add-on open to all base plans (Value Added Service).

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether add-ons of same type but different amount are allowed.
Attributes.Definition: Add-ons of same type but different amount can be restricted so that a customer should select one particular add-on within same type because of different price calculations. On the other hand, this restriction can be lifted so that a customer can mix add-ons of different amounts of same type because the charges for each add-on is paid individually.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify segments allowed to subscribe to the plan.
Attributes.Definition: Certain customer categories or segments can be allowed to subscribe to this plan.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether change flavor of base plan should change the add-on flavor.
Attributes.Definition: If the add-on is restricted to a specific base plan and "Base Plan Coupling" is enabled, the add-on flavor will be changed when the base plan flavor is changed during upgrade/downgrade. For example, a Device Silver add-on which is restricted to Silver base plan will be changed automatically to Device Gold add-on when the base plan is upgraded to Gold flavor.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify Finance GL code for the rateplan.
Attributes.Definition: GL (General Ledger) Code is used by Finance for revenue bookings.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify launch date of the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the official launch of the plan for sale.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify number of this same add-on that a user can subscribe.
Attributes.Definition: Multiple add-ons of same type can be restricted to a specific number. If 0 is entered, then customer can get any number of this add-on.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional requirements on Add-on property can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify CBCM Package Code for the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Package Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify CBCM Package Description for the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Every package has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify base plan flavors that are allowed by this add-on.
Attributes.Format: "Base Plan flavor 1;Base Plan flavor 2;Base Plan flavor 3;Other Base Plan flavors (auto populated)"
Attributes.Definition: Add-on can be limited to specific set of Base Plan flavors or all the Base Plan flavors within selected Services.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify product groups that are allowed by this add-on.
Attributes.Format: "Product Group 1;Product Group 2;Product Group 3;Other Product Groups (auto populated)"
Attributes.Definition: Add-on can be limited to specific set of Product Groups.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify services that are allowed by this add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Add-on can be limited to specific set of Services or all the services within selected Product Groups.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify add-ons that are restricted to be provisioned with this add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Some add-ons are not be allowed to be provisioned to satisfy the business case.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify CBCM Rateplan Code for the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Rateplan Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify CBCM Rateplan Description for the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Every rateplan has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify add-ons that are required by this add-on.
Attributes.Definition: These are pre-requisited whereby an add-on cannot be provisioned unless other add-on is provisioned first. Example of this is the discounted Device add-on that can be given only when there is a Data add-on.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify required role names for the CRM user to grant access.
Attributes.Definition: Role name can be used to restrict the CRM users which are allowed to see and provision the base plan.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify date when the rateplan was closed for sale.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the rateplan deactivated in CBCM.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify date when the rateplan was opened for sale.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the rateplan activated in CBCM.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify discontinuation date of the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Date of stopping the plan for sale.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether group call, message, and data are enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Group usages are mostly allowed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether Data is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Data service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Data enabled. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no "Data Freebees" or "Data Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether International Balance Transfer is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: A subscriber can transfer a credit to another user internationally. Balance transfer can happen via USSD code.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether incoming call, message, and data are enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Incoming roaming usages are mostly allowed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether international call, message, and data are enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: International usages are mostly allowed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether 4G Data capability is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: 4G network is faster than 3G network.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether MMS message is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Messaging service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Messaging service enabled even for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no MMS "Message Freebees" or MMS "Message Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether outgoing call, message, and data are enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Outgoing roaming usages are mostly allowed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether SMS message is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Messaging service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Messaging service enabled even for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no SMS "Message Freebees" or SMS "Message Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether local call, message, and data are enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Local usages are mostly allowed.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether User (National) Balance Transfer is enable or not.
Attributes.Definition: A subscriber can transfer a credit to another user locally. Balance transfer can happen via USSD code.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether video call is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Video service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Video service enabled even for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no video "Call Freebees" or video "Call Usage" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether voice call is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Voice call service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Voice service enabled except for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no "Call Freebees" or "Call Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify segments allowed to subscribe to the plan.
Attributes.Definition: Certain customer categories or segments can be allowed to subscribe to this plan.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify name of the plan.
Attributes.Definition: Base plan name must be a unique name that should not be repeated in any service. Base plan name should include flavor name so it is distinctively identifiable.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify format of the special number that are eligible by this base plan.
Attributes.Definition: A subscriber can be eligible for certain special number formats or categories as part of the base plan offer. --Example of special number format: 050-1234XXX. Example of special number categories: Silver Special Numbers or Diamond Special Numbers.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify Finance GL code for the rateplan.
Attributes.Definition: GL (General Ledger) Code is used by Finance for revenue bookings.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify launch date of the base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the official launch of the plan for sale.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify number of this same add-on that a user can subscribe.
Attributes.Definition: Multiple base plan of same type can be restricted to a specific number. If 0 is entered, then customer can get any number of this base plan.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional requirements on Base Plan property can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify CBCM Package Code for the base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Package Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify CBCM Package Description for the base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Every package has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify type of the base plan payment: Prepaid/Postpaid.
Attributes.Definition: A base plan can be Prepaid or Postpaid. Selecting this option has multiple consequences including but not limited to: Day of Monthly Charge, Day of Freebees Refill, Standard Call Usage Charge, and Invoice. Note that a Prepaid account can exist inside Postpaid forming a structure known as Hybrid account.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether roaming service should be pre-activated automatically or not.
Attributes.Definition: Roaming service should be enabled in order to make roaming usages (Call, Message, or Data). Note there are also different caps for roaming usage which are configurable per customer if they meet the cap criteria.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify CBCM Primary Package Code.
Attributes.Definition: Primary Package Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a base service to a customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify add-ons that are prohibited on this base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Some add-ons are not be allowed to be provisioned to satisfy the business case.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify CBCM Rateplan Code for the base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Rateplan Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify CBCM Rateplan Description for the base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Every rateplan has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify required role names for the CRM user to grant access.
Attributes.Definition: Role name can be used to restrict the CRM users which are allowed to see and provision the base plan.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify class of the plan.
Attributes.Definition: Service class specifies the main category of the base plan.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify date when the rateplan was closed for sale.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the rateplan deactivated in CBCM.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify date when the rateplan was opened for sale.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the rateplan activated in CBCM.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify discontinuation date of the base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Date of stopping the plan for sale.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify whether to create a new base plan or modify an existing base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Modifying an existing base plan will affect all existing customers who are using it. Creating a new base plan will not impact existing customers.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify eligible category of the special MSISDN number.
Attributes.Definition: Special MSISDN numbers of certain category can be given to the subscriber.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify eligible format of the special MSISDN number.
Attributes.Definition: Special MSISDN numbers of certain format can be given to the subscriber. --For example, "050 1234 ???" will allow the customer to take numbers like 050 1234 825, 050 1234 343, and 050 1234 888.

Attributes.Prompt: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on MSISDN can be added here.

Attributes.Definition: Extra SIM Charge

Attributes.Definition: Extra SIM Monthly Charge

Attributes.Definition: First SIM Charge

Attributes.Definition: Max Allowed SIMs

Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on SIM Card can be added here.

Attributes.Prompt: Specify one-time charge of each additional SIM card.
Attributes.Definition: Extra SIM Charge
